messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Its been fun, but leaving group till kids older
messages.msgSnippet: ... The group IS for experienced or at least dedicated unschoolers. There are other groups listed here, with one for beginners and one for people with very
messages.messageBody:
On Mar 9, 2006, at 10:18 AM, cathyandgarth wrote:

> IMHO, it feels like there is a general assumption here that if you are
> just starting out you are probably doing it wrong. It seems like the
> focus is more on what is wrong as opposed to what is right and
> supporting nurturing those things.

The group IS for experienced or at least dedicated unschoolers.

There are other groups listed here, with one for beginners and one
for people with very young children:
http://sandadodd.com/lists/other


There's more reading here
http://sandradodd.com/help

at the bottom are other people's websites (you'll be on mine at that
point) and blogs.

Sandra

messages.subject: Its been fun, but leaving group till kids older
messages.msgSnippet: I have enjoyed the insight that I have gotten from this group, but I think that it is geared toward folks with older kids, so I will be trying out some other
messages.messageBody:
I have enjoyed the insight that I have gotten from this group, but I
think that it is geared toward folks with older kids, so I will be
trying out some other unschool message boards to see if they better
meet my needs.
IMHO, it feels like there is a general assumption here that if you are
just starting out you are probably doing it wrong. It seems like the
focus is more on what is wrong as opposed to what is right and
supporting nurturing those things.
I am sure I will see many of you at the conference in Sept. It will
be fun to put faces and families to names.
I really should have spent many more weeks just lurking, but I was
just too excited to get involved.

Thanks again!
Cathy
